text: Eduard Jan Bomhoff (born September 30, 1944 in Amsterdam) is a Dutch economist and academic, and also former politician and columnist. Bomhoff studied at Leiden University and Erasmus University Rotterdam. From July to October 2002, he was on behalf of the Pim Fortuyn List (LPF) government minister of Health, Welfare and Sports and also deputy prime minister in the First Balkenende Cabinet. He is a member of the Old Catholic Church. == References == * Bio at Parlement.com Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:Deputy Prime Ministers of the Netherlands Category:Dutch academics Category:Dutch Christians Category:Dutch columnists Category:Dutch economists Category:Government ministers of the Netherlands Category:Old Catholics Category:Pim Fortuyn List politicians Category:Politicians from Amsterdam Category:Writers from Amsterdam
title: Eduard Bomhoff
